headline: The Parable of the Supply Room
description: A meditation on divine purpose within imperfection. Every soul, whether saintly or soiled, serves within the greater machinery of creation. In the image of a hospital‚Äôs supply room, the parable reveals that holiness is not in purity alone, but in function and necessity ‚Äî that even the lowliest vessel carries the mystery of God‚Äôs design.

motifMap.meaning: The hospital as the microcosm of creation ‚Äî ordered by suffering and service.
Hidden sanctum of necessity ‚Äî each object purposeful, none exalted.
Healing as participation in divine repair ‚Äî human acts mending God‚Äôs creation.
Symbol of humility ‚Äî the acceptance of lowly purpose without shame.
The unknowable structure of divine will ‚Äî every cog meaningful though unseen.
